Reviews.Title: “Average accomodation. Kids happy!”
Reviews.Author: Nose68
Reviews.Content: Travelling with tho kids an wife, two nights stay, booked from the hotel interent site (very efficent). Offered a "modern suite" but nothing modern there to be honest. Room was clean but too narrow, low roof, one bath room only., while a freind travelling with me got the same modern suite two rooms and two bathroom basically. Furniture is old enough,need a rifurbishment. Food is below avg, if u are italian, nothing special, dining room is ok, staff is sometime not aware what they are doing (asked for some pork steaks and got chicken.!!!) Breakfast is poor quality, but employees deserve a special mention for their efforts and service offered. Spa is good but you pay for that. All in all good for a budget holiday..Venice is much more expensive i guess. Location is ok , close to ferry and Vaporetto. Would stay again but avoid restaurant (al carte is too expensive for what you get). Piano man is ok but.... who cares. Just bed and brakfast....many restaurants around...

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: tan c Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine friendly staff the location ok( water bus 28euro for 48hour)only thing not good is hotel too warn

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: stephwen
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with friendly staff. Our room was available several hours before the expected check-in time, which is always great. The jacuzzi and the rest of the spa are very relaxing and nicely decorated. The breakfast wasn't the best we've had in 4 stars hotels, but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DianeGreen53
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while on an organized tour of Italy in October 2008 and loved it then, so when I returned to Venice in November 2011 I chose to stay there again. This hotel is grand inside and out. The buffet syle breakfast is wonderful with many choices, hot and cold. The room in which guests have breakfast is stunning, very cheerful and bright. Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed, Despite it being mid November., we slept with the garden doors open and were not cold. Although the furnishings are dated througout the hotel they give a certain ambiance to the place. In its hayday this was "the place to be" and I think that as that era was its best, the hotel attempts to revive that time in its history. The hallways are a gallery of photos taken from the time the hotel opened until the early 1960's. Instead of viewing these negatively as in some other reviews here, I thought they were quite charming. It wasn't hard to imagine this hotel during that time. The staff were eager to help us plan our days and always greeted us with a smile. The hotel provided free parking behine the hotel and is onlly a five minute walk to the water taxi stop. There are lots of good restaraunts on the island as well. Lido also has the only sand beaches in Venice, right at the end of the main street, within an easy walk from the hotel. It was wonderful to stay on Lido, away from the mainland hussle and bussle. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel and will stay there again if I visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights while visiting Venice. The pros are few but deserve mention - the building is attractive from the outside, the rooms are clean, the restaurant is in a grand room with a nice pianist, the hotel is just 5 minutes walk from the vaporetto stop, and the staff are friendly enough. However: 1. Room - the room was boiling boiling hot and we couldn't do anything about it; the curtains get caught in the window when it's open; in our room 307); as others have said, the furniture and decor is pretty dated; we had a table/mirror in our room with discoloured cracked glass; the corridors too were very very hot 2. Restaurant - under no circumstances should you eat in the restaurant! In spite of what I'm sure are their best efforts, the menu is terrible and the food completely over-salted. 3. Atmosphere - I know that we were there off-season, but the entire atmosphere was completely un-Italian. We were there at carnival time, and the hotel decorations stretched to a few party hats draped on statues. The whole vibe (especially with all of the dated photographs on the wall) was of Bognor Regis in the 60s and 70s! 4. Wi-Fi - we paid through the teeth for a Junior Suite (see above for our thoughts on the room) and on the morning we checked out I asked for the Wi-Fi code to do online check-in. As we were just leaving, the nice man on reception gave it to us free.....but before he realised we were leaving that day we were going to get charged 20 Euros for 24 hours Wi-Fi usage. At the price, I would absolutely expect Wi-Fi to have been included. I'm sorry to say that we considered leaving the hotel and taking our chances in Venice itself. The Lido is probably much better in summer! We came to this hotel after three nights at a three star hotel (note, this hotel says four star!) in Rome which was in every way superior.

Reviews.Title: “What drives the spa business, perhaps?”
Reviews.Author: rickbutler
Reviews.Content: Having admired this uniquely decorated compound on past visits, and preferring Lido and its beaches and greenery to the hubbub of the city proper, we decided this time around to book in. And for the most part, we were pleased with our low-season stay. As mentioned by other reviewers, the place is dated. However, the interior well suits the mosaic facade and surrounding sculpture garden and thereby adds to its charm. Due to what looks an extensive bout of refurbishment, the rooms possess a contemporary veneer even if what that veneer covers in terms of the underlying plumbing, flooring and ventilation remains evident. Meanwhile, the conservatory that hosts an ample breakfast and the adjoining restaurant and bar areas more outwardly retain the ambience of a bygone age. As well, there's a facility in the basement that offers all manner of Oriental treatment and therapies, which proved a useful amenity given the single, glaring omission in the renovation. I am speaking of the beds, which dominated our standard double room and featured twins placed side-by-side. While this arrangement was not unexpected, the condition of the mattresses was such that one was forced to sleep in a swale and awoke with body aches that failry demanded massage, Thai or otherwise, to relieve them. After a day of trodding the city to see the sights, an evening's contortionism is decidedly unwelcome. Alerted to this failing, the friendly staff vowed the situation would be addressed. Given we'll not be back to Venice again for a number of months, there's certainly time to get it right (at least, for us). We'll be sure to check here to see what others find in the interim before deciding whether to book again. The upshot is that the Ansonia & Hungaria looks and feels the part of a grand hotel, but those comforts ended for us in a terrible night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JayBombH
Reviews.Content: Extremely well recommended, the food, people, area and everything in this hotel was fab. Took my girlfriend to Venice for a holiday and stayed on the lido, waterbus to the city center was so easy to do and very convenient if not a little expensive....but well worth it.....the Lido was fantastic, beach was not too far away, think the only thing i would have wanted would have been a pool area but i cant gripe!! We came back engaged having done it on the beach late one night!! Well recommended..we went 1st week of October and nothing was closed or shutting down!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand in real sense.”
Reviews.Author: amit_pallavi
Reviews.Content: Very nice art nouveau hotel with amazingly good staff. We stayed in a suite which was tastefully decorated with Victorian furniture and all modern amenities such as satellite TVs, telephone facilities, well stocked mini bar, and much more. The suite had two bathrooms which were clean fully equipped with good toiletries. The best part of the hotel was the buffet breakfast which was grand and was served in romantic winter garden. Very quiet and relaxing spa center. We stayed there for 4 days and one day we were forced to stay in the hotel as it was raining all day, me and my husband enjoyed the thai massage, it was so relaxing and revitalizing. The hotel is very near to the water taxi stand and Lido beach. I would suggest that people who come to holiday in Venice better stay in Lido than in main Venice city and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with character and charm”
Reviews.Author: Ralph B
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to this hotel we were very impressed. There is a feeling of real warmth and welcome as you enter this hotel. The hotel and room was clean and the staff is friendly and very helpful. It is a good location, situated only 3 minutes walking distance to the water taxi to Venice and the airport, and walking around the area is really lovely. The buffet breakfast was excellent, varied and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, outside of main Venice”
Reviews.Author: janet r
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, at a great price. It is located very near to the ferry stop so it is easy to get into Venice. There isn't much to do in Lido but it is a quiet area and very relaxing. Complimentary breakfast was wonderful: eggs, bacon, fruit, yogurt, cheese, bread... The room was very spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was also quite large. Had a great experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lovely spot not impressed with the restaurant though”
Reviews.Author: Dawnywawny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here For 4 nights as a mini honeymoon after our wedding. We didn't boom until the day before we even left ! We were so tired that we decided we didn't want to stay in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Venice itself so we stayed in this hotel in the island of Lido. It's a lovely area with nice restaurants and to stroll around and there is great beach also. The vaparetto is only a ten min ride in to st marks square which we enjoyed. The food in the hotel was very disappointing so we only ate there one night. We had great treatments in the spa and the staff are really friendly. Our room was a little bit on the small side but it suited us as we were gone most of the day. All in all I would recommend it for somewhere relaxing and not too expensive, and still close enough to the hustle and bustle of Venice. X

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ghui
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. We had a large room on the top floor that was incredlibly spacious. The bathroom was huge and very clean. It had plenty of storage space and was decorated in a really cute beach-hotel style. The location was perfect - only a few minutes walk to the waterbus station station to go into Venice yet away from the hustle and bustle. We went for dinner at the hotel one night which was fun but a bit pricy! We also went to 2 other restaurants on the Lido strip which was nice as after a busy day sightseeing we really didn't feel like going into the centre of town. The staff were friendly and the hotel had a lovely atmosphere - I would recommed it!

Reviews.Title: “Front row seat in the heart of Lido”
Reviews.Author: Damsko_020
Reviews.Content: At first arrival you will not think that the colourful building is your hotel .. but that is where the charm begins. Friendly staff at entrance, spacious and very nice decor. Rooms are lovely, although I wouldn't recommend the rooms on the top floor, as warm air travels, your room is slightly warmer. Find out the hard way that the cooler for the airco was turned off as the warm season had ended (October travel), but it was still blooming warm. This was solved by just leaving the window on a crack .. Being in the centre of the Lido, few hundred meters from the Waterbus station and not far from the Ferry either, it isn't very loud, although there is always something to do on the strip. As said, the transport to the main island of Venice and others, such as Murano, are only a short bustrip away, and at a very low price. I would recommend buying a multi-hour travel card (at the station on the island) as you will be using it more than you think .. Free WiFi in the Hotel was handy and available. Breakfast was very continental, for those who don't like it... there are plenty of trattorias in the are to get your alternatives and more local food. Free car parking space was excellent, as you are not allowed to drive in Venice, but at least you won't have to leave your car on the mainland (out of sight).

Reviews.Title: “great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MDKbrisbane
Reviews.Content: we love this place. very quirky outside and some of the decorations in the front garden are strange but seem to work somehow. great location - staff friendly. the room we had was large and clean but didnt look like the photos on the net - abit older looking in real life. the hotel had great atmosphere. breakfast was good and the staff very helpful and friendly. the hotel had a good outside area to have a drink or eat. very nice after a long day sightseeing. very close to the ferry and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “charming friendly hospitality is superb”
Reviews.Author: Irina S
Reviews.Content: Good situated -can go to beach or to Venice every day. The bulding is original modern/ Many people make foto. Sometime live music- very nice latino 30 years. Staff is very friendly and professional. It is prifitable to take not only breakfast but halfpension.

Reviews.Title: “It was "okay"”
Reviews.Author: hgreenwood
Reviews.Content: Well, upfront - I have to say we booked the cheapest room. So the room was "okay" not more not less, the furniture is old, the room was small and not really cozy. The hotel itself and the staff was very friendly, the location is great and the breakfast was also quite nice ... but nothing special. All-in-all I would say if you book a suite or something it can be a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second best on the Lido”
Reviews.Author: Hardiman_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hungaria Palace about 4 years ago when they were renovating as we were with a tour of Italy and thought then it was a very nice place for Easy Pace Italy to stay in considering we were only a package tour. The photos made the place look 5 star. This year we went back and dined at the hotel on a few nights and as the renovations are finished noticed what a difference money can make. If you cant afford to stay at the Excelsior on the Lido you should stay here as its got a prime position and close to everything. Be careful when ordering meat at dinner time Ours cost over 100euros for 2 of us because we couldnt understand what the amount of meat we were getting and we are small eaters. It would have fed 4 people. Drinks were good there Would recommend the HOTEL if you want to be on the Lido

Reviews.Title: “Stunning unique Liberty restoration”
Reviews.Author: SimpaticoUK
Reviews.Content: I went past this hotel in 2005just before restoration began . Now owner Dr Russo can see the efforts of several very hard years of super meticulous work in restoring the Hotel to its former splendour Building at Ausonia was started in 1904 Its the largest external majolica example in Europe.To restore the unique tiles Russo tracked down the orginal moulds from Bassano , and the original quarry for the raw materials The railings do not a have a single weld .....only the original 1904 method of nail/ rivet was used. Every pice of parquet was returned to its original exact position after restoration. A Parquet which has hosted Royalty and Vips in the hundreds since it was biuilt And so on . So this is one of the most "authentic" hotels one can ever stay in . Here the Italian superintendents for historical buildings ran a very positive , very strict control . With a hugely positive effect . NB This is not a take away pizza hotel . Its a return to the superb class that befits Venice and its world famous Lido During my visit it was hosting classy , prestige looking guests and I enjoyed the "lifestyle " feeling the whole place emitted . But Ausonia & Hungaria holds another world class secret Dr Russo has spent years studying a rare anthropological culture from Asia which is the basis of the extraordinary Wellness Center below ground level Simply stunning for its authenticity , range of wellness applications , superb relaxing and quiet ambience and an attention to wellness detail I have never encountered elsewhere . Authenticity down to the very finest thought out detail So with a context like this it follows the food and rooms are of a similar standard The hotel is nearer by Vaporetto to St Marco than arriving from Venice station. With the added plus of the beaches on the long sinuous stretch of the Lido How refreshing to see a beautiful hotel restored with such obvious and constant passion Totally recommend it you are into taste , style , atmosphere .

Reviews.Title: “Forewarned it's not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: traintimeables
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grande Albergo Ausonia & Hungaria in July 2011 and the best part was leaving. I found the staff were quite snotty at reception. The lamps did not work in our room nor the TV, the noise from outside is very loud and it is difficult to get any sleep. I was exhausted by the time we left. The pictures are completely decieving as the room was nowhere near the standard of the pictures on their site. There are prently of alternatives that are cheaper so do yourself and favour and check into them instead.

Reviews.Title: “run, for god's sake, don't stop”
Reviews.Author: DamienMurphy
Reviews.Content: My wife, my mother and I stayed here at the end of July 2011. The holiday was to help my mother get over the recent passing of my father. None of us will ever be back to this truly awful hotel.. Before we booked the room, we rang the hotel to confirm that we were seeking two separate bedrooms in our suite. The hotel advised us that such a room was available. This was also confirmed by email. To start with on arrival the hotel facade is impressive, but that was as good as it got, we were meet by a condescending receptionist, who told us where our room was and no mention of help with the suitcases, my wife was pregnant and my mother was in her mid sixties. We trundled into the antiquated lift and arrived at our "suite". The "suite" comprised of a box room with some poor quality furniture and a fold up bed in the corner. In the far corner was a gap in the wall towards the main bedroom. No door and certainly not two separate rooms as advised from the staff. Therefore my wife and I had to share a room with my mother for three nights. We then noticed that the panelling was coming off the door. We asked the receptionist for some extra pillows and we told that we probably wouldnâ€™t get any as they were full. That night there was a party in the bar and the noise was horrendous. It was at this stage that we realised that double glazed windows were a luxury that we would not get. Then we got into our beds, which must have been made of concrete. So if you want a hotel that looks great on the outside, with the rudest staff and worst nightâ€™s sleep youâ€™ll ever get then the Grande Albergo Ausonia & Hungaria is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A huge, rip off, disapointment.”
Reviews.Author: Baronsam
Reviews.Content: On first appearances, this hotel looks fabulous put inside lurks rude waiting staff, expensive, badly cooked food, cheap quality breakfast in a conservatory that has no air conditioning - they don't allow you to take breakfast on the terrace - and cramped, over priced bedrooms, even at Venice prices. On the plus side, the reception staff are helpful and the ride from Venice to the Lido is one of life's small treats. Don't waste your money, stay at one of the other better priced local hotels, many of whom have great breakfasts and eat out on the Lido, much better prices than mainland Venice. I have stayed on the Lido several times and this is, without doubt, the greatest rip off and dissapointment I have had when it comes to holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and over rated. Appalling food and service.”
Reviews.Author: hopeeddy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has potential to be grand but the finish is quite cheap ie hairdryers, bedding, tinned fruit at breakfast. The restaurant and half board are completely overpriced and the half board menu is appalling and a total con - it doesn't say anywhere when you book that the choice of half board food is just 2 straters, 2 main courses and one dessert - it doesn't even cater for non pork or seafood eaters, so perhaps some religions aren't welcome? If you manage to get a deal where the room is below 90 euros per night, maybe risk it but otherwise go elsewhere. There are plenty of good quality more reasonably priced hotels and restaurants on the Lido so just visit the Albergo for a drink and photo oppurtunity.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the restaurant and half board like the plague!!”
Reviews.Author: netty_jeddy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not quite as grand as it believes it is. Minor details like inefficient hairdryers that are attached to the bathroom wall and burn your hand and cheap blankets spoil otherwise lovely rooms but what lets it down most is the restaurant and it's waiting staff. Firstly, nowhere on it's website does it make clear that half board means you have to choose from a VERY limited menu - 2 starters, 2 mains and one dessert - but the head waiter actually cut off mid sentence to serve other customers when my husband stated we were half board. We were treated with disdain and felt marginalised and patronised and the food quality was by far the worst we ate anywhere in Italy. One night my main course consisted of 4 scampi with some boiled carrots - not exactly fine dining or worth the 65 euros we paid for it. We then had to ask for our dessert after 25 minutes and when it came it was a cheap quality cake with 2 segments of tinned pineapple in it. I'm not a fussy eater and we are a very tolerant, well travelled and laid back couple but our stay there was ruined by the attitude of waiting staff and the manager. The manager eventually offered a 30 euro refund if we didn't eat there on our second night but, despite keeping us waiting, we never actually got to meet him or her. If this hotel had a change of waiting staff and chef, it could be one of the great hotels but my suggestion is to visit there, take photos of the fantastic outside, enjoy a cocktail on the beautiful terrrace then walk over the road to one of the many restaurants there. Breakfast was ok but the reception and breakfast staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a very quiet place.”
Reviews.Author: Irina94
Reviews.Content: We spent only 24 hours on Venice Lido island, but enjoyed both the hotel and place itself. The hotel looks great inside and outside, rooms (we had 207) are huge and very convenient, all staff members are friendly and ready to help. We would recommend this hotel for those who prefers calmer enviroment while having all the possibilities to admire Venice, which is only 20 min. (St. Mark's Sq) public boat ride distance. Besides food and drinks are twice cheaper here. And very nice beach is very close to the hotel also! So enjoy it as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel management and staff went above and beyond to please!”
Reviews.Author: searcher33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Many guests took photos of the exterior of the hotel because it was so impressive.The friendly hotel staff spoke English and were very well trained.They went above and beyond to please. There was a good selection of food for breakfast .We had dinner in the Quarti restaurant with its refined ambiance one night.The art on the walls was impressive.The food was very tasty and the waiters were excellent.There are good cafes and restaurants a short walk from the hotel if you don't want to eat dinner at the hotel. The bedroom was very clean and we slept well.We had free internet.All we had to do was ask reception for a password which lasted two hours.Extra time is available by asking for another password when the first one expires. We had a pleasant stay in this elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel art nouveau, great location and value”
Reviews.Author: SigfridItaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel has class (liberty architectural style, nice furniture from the late 19th century, colorful facade made of tiles forming dancing figures). People at the front desk were professional and kind. My room and bathroom were large, functional and well decorated. Nice small garden with fountain in the frontyard of the hotel. Great value in comparison to Venice (less than half the price for the same category). Conveniently located at 3 minutes walk from Santa maria elisabetta vaporetti, in a large street with other beautiful buildings and villas.. Another plus is a Billa supermarket at 1 minute walking. The only disappointment is breakfast, definitely not at the level of everything else. Did not try the spa. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: poppybach
Reviews.Content: The room was quirky and fun having a very sloped high ceiling. It was a large room even though we had only booked a standard. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The breakfast was the usual faire of cheese, meat, bread, cereal and fruit. The hotel looked stunning and very cool on the outside. The Lido is the best place to stay in Venice be sure to rent a two person or family bike to explore the island. There was a spa in the hotel but we did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Bet”
Reviews.Author: 737wendy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night trip to Venice, where we stayed at the Grande Albergo on the Lido Island. We arrived on an Easy Jet flight into Marco Polo airport. We then took the blue-line river boat to the Lido. It cost 25 Euro each for a return ticket which we brought from the machine in the airport (selecting English as our preferred choice). The journey took about 40 mins before we stopped at the Lido. On disembarking we walked up Elizabeta Avenue and found the hotel easily. It was about 200metres on the right hand side and is very grande looking. The staff in reception were very friendly and helpful as were all the staff at the hotel. The room was an economy room and it was clean and comfortable, and by European standards - a decent size. The only downside for me was that we ordered a double room and found that we had two single beds pushed together - also, there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room. Breakfast was ok. There was plenty of choice, including a fresh fruit selection, which I particularly like. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant as we wanted to experience as much as we could in Venice, but I did have a massage in the Wellness Centre in the basement, which was excellent and cost around 75 Euro. One thing to point out, is that you have to pay 20 Euro each, each time you use the Spa. The Spa has a Sauna, Steamroom and Jacuzzi. It is probably in the small print that they charge 20 Euro each, but I wasn't aware. I kind of assumed that it would be free for hotel guests... Venice itself is amazing! The wine, the water and the weather. It's very pretty and was worth every penny (except for the 'coverto' - cover charge - and 'servico' - service charge, that you have to look out for). However, if you look carefully, you can find some lovely places where this is not applicable. You can buy a 72hr water bus ticket for 33 Euro at the Lido stop. But make sure you ask for your change. To sum it up, this hotel is a safe bet if you're going to Venice. It's clean and tidy and the staff are friendly and helpful. The location on the Lido is good and the water bus into St Marks and other places, runs frequently and is a good price. It's probably being a bit ambitious calling itself a 4 star, but If I went back to Venice and was looking for somewhere to stay, at the price I paid, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great, either.”
Reviews.Author: lkardatz
Reviews.Content: Don't let the 4 star rating or photos of the facade fool you - this is just a pretty run of the mill hotel. The hallways and rooms aren't as nice as the entryway or lobby. But, if you're looking for something decent that's removed from the hustle and bustle of the mainland, then this hotel on Lido is something to consider. It's located about a 5 minute walk from the Lido water bus stop and about a 15-20 minute ride from San Marco. Pros: -120 minutes of free internet use (must ask front desk for password) -Free breakfast -Modestly priced -Good location on Lido, a bit far from the rest of Venice Cons: -Breakfast was just OK -Staff not all that friendly or helpful -Small rooms -Water changed temperate and pressure constantly, leaked from shower -Housekeeping comes very early in the morning Nothing was TERRIBLE but nothing wowed us either.

Reviews.Title: “beware of the pictures on the web-site of this place to not correspond the reality at all”
Reviews.Author: ElenaP1139
Reviews.Content: It is very disappointing that some hotels do that: pictures of the rooms represented at their web-sites do not at all reflect what they are in reality. It is absolutely so about this hotel. Having booked a room at that 4-star hotel we were expecting something corresponding to that category. It is not at all: the staff is awful starting from the receptionist who hardly speaks English and would really not bother much to say hello or give you any sort of a welcome smile when you enter the hotel. The rooms look nothing at all as on the web-site. They are very old and shabby, and do require renovation right away. A bathroom is something one does not want to see at all. They are awful. The interior of the hotel is also very old and there is some smell which reminds you of a canteen where the food may only be disgusting. The only thing which is truly beautiful about the place is the exterior of the hotel. From the outside the building does look nice, but I would recommend everyone not to be mistaken because of it. There is absolutely nothing else in that hotel but the exterior look. Having arrived and seen the ugly reception area and the dedicated for us room, I have asked the receptionist to show us any other rooms of higher categories which if we liked and decided to stay, we would have obviously paid the required extra. But fact of the matter is even they turned out to be disgusting. And those most awful bathrooms, if they can be called like that at all, were still the same. The floors design and condition leave much to be desired too, to put it mildly. So, what we did having seen all that nightmare being called a 4-star hotel is left. There is really nothing else to do. Later on we stayed in a great place that day, though 5-star and in Venice itself, but really marvelous. A few days later I contacted that Grande Albergo Ausonia & Hungaria Wellness & Spa hotel telling them what the situation was and asking if they would consider that situation and give us any refund (we were supposed to stay in that ugly hotel from Jan 7 through Jan 9, 2011, but had booked a non-refundable tariff) because it was obviously not our fault that the pictures on their web-site had misled us that much. But I got a "no" from the hotel, which only proves in a nasty place everything corresponds to its level. Please, be aware the pictures on the web-site of that hotel are absolutely not what this particular hotel is in reality. You will get very disappointed. And it is not good especially when you come to Venice where there are quite a few great hotels. We stayed in 2 of them during our 2 stays in Venice. Best regards, Elena, citizenship - Russian

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: janedona
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic trip to venice, and paid a total of Â£275 per couple for 4 days in Venice,flying with Ryanair, and staying at this hotel B&B. We have never had such good value! The hotel was grand, beautiful, clean, well-placed, good breakfast, great coffee... We had paid for the cheapest room, thinking we wouldn't be there much, but were actually given one of the original, grand highceilinged rooms on the first floor. It was newly-decorated and beautifully furnished with old. original furniture. We actually changed from the first room to one on the 2nd floor - bigger and grander with a 4-poster bed because we wanted a bath. The only miniscule complaint was that this room didn't have a bath either! The breakfast was lovely - plenty of choice, served in the original conservatory with beautiful stained glass windows overlooking a picturesque Venetian garden. We arrived at Plaza del Roma from the airport and activated our bus passes (bought on Venice connected at a discounted rate) and got a No1 waterbus which took us right down the grand canal and across to the Lido - a fantastic overview of Venice, and a great way of getting your bearings, and lots of photo-opportunities. We chose this longer route across to Venice each morning and evening because it was so relaxing, and such lovely views. We loved staying on the Lido, which was a different vibe altogether from Venice, relaxed, quite upmarket, with a real community spirit. We ate each night in 'Glacial' a little wine bar just up from the hotel, very good value, lovely fresh cooked pasta and pizza, but go a notch up from the house red! I cannot recommend Venice or this hotel highly enough. Oh, and 70 euros for 40 minutes in a gondola - do it, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and attentive friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TripDrug
Reviews.Content: Arriving in front of this hotel in the evening after a boat ride from the airport is lovely, the whole building is attractively lit up and very welcoming. Check-in was painless and the room we had was in one of the turrets, a tasteful and well-appointed room with great views across the lido. This was quite a surprise because we booked a 3-day package with dinner included, and as the hotel was clearly full, we imagined that we would have a more basic room. Dinner was in the restaurant on the ground floor and was a choice from a fixed menu. There were two parts to the restaurant, one for the group and one for the individual guests. Despite being busy the staff were attentive and very friendly. There were no vegetarian options on the menu but this proved to be no problem for the staff, who had several suggestions and were more inventive than the usual salad-combo. The wine recommendation was excellent (and by no means the most expensive on the menu). This was actually the perfect end to the day. The hotel is situated on the lido part of venice, a 7-minute boat ride to the main part of the city and all the better for it, with a certain calm and elegance "far from the madding crowd"... Our excursions into the city were punctuated by these boat rides to and from the different ports and added greatly to the more formal sense of "day trip" or "night trip" I tested the spa in the hotel for a back massage and was very pleasently surprised by a very professional service from an expert masseurse. The whole layout is quite oriental chi-chi and the fear upon arrival is that this is "all lotus petals and no benefit", but whilst I'm not generally inclined to sit around sniffing sandlewood this was money very well spent. I'm partial to a massage here and there and can attest that this was one of the best I've had. The breakfast was in a delightful winter garden part of the hotel - imagine white ironwork and tall windows, some with coloured glass (tastefully done) overlooking a garden. It's best to arrive early and have the peace of the view and the opportunity to stroll around the buffet, as opposed to having to queue for your roll. The spread was good, all self-service including coffee, which is a bonus, especially when the room is full and you want a second latte. I frankly couldn't fault the hotel and would certainly stay here again if I ever returned to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Once will do”
Reviews.Author: Northstarxxx
Reviews.Content: On booking the hotel online, me and my partner were very excited at the prospect of staying at this particular venue as the pictures and reviews seemed to offer much. Unfortunately the only real charm of this place lies in it's exterior as the room was very small and facilities minimal. Though we did not make use of the spa, we did have a peek and it looked ok ,and for Â£15 seemed quite reasonable. When researching this hotel, we understood that it had a private beach just outside of the hotel. Actually it is a 10 minute walk to the beach but it was pleasant enough in all fairness but that is all I can say about it. The breakfast was much like I expected with a wide range of cold meats, pastries and cereals, be wary of the scrambled eggs though! We ate in two different resaturants while on Lido Island, and all I can say is don't! Venice is a 15 minute boat ride away and much more likely to provide a culinary pleasure than Lido island ever will. Venice itself is magical and best experienced at night when the little tapas bars come to life. We spent our final night in Venice wandering the historic streets eating and drinking in several of the quaint little bars. Take my advice and head for the market area near the Rialto bridge for the best of these, where apparently you can eat cheaply with the locals during the day and drink with the same at night. All in all, I would recommend Venice to everyone but make sure you choose hotel and restaurant carefully. Hotel 5/10, Lido island, 6/10 Venice 9/10.

Reviews.Title: “A funny ol' hotel but an enjoyable time had!”
Reviews.Author: HS-londoner
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with someone's review below stating that this has the air of Fawlty Towers (which made me laugh!) The hotel itself from the outside looks incredibly grand and interesting... inside I would still say it's interesting although slightly dilapidated and run down. The hotel is clean and the room we eventually stayed in was nice. We were initially put in a small double room which had a peculiar smell and was above the kitchen fans/generators which kicked out a lot of noise. We raised this with the front desk on our way out and asked if it was just in the day that this noise would occur. The looked a little sheepish and said they weren't sure what we were referring to but they 'thought' it would stop by night... On our return to our room the smell was still in the room (an over strong air freshner trying to mask something) and the generator noise. We went straight back to the front desk to ask to change rooms, they were very accommodating with this and moved us straight away (to a room which was larger and a whole lot nicer). If we had to stay in the same room the hotel experience would be awful and this would be a totally different review but as we did move I have to say our hotel stay was great. Breakfast was OK, a large spread, not the best I've had in Italy but certainly not the worst and the breakfast staff were great. The location is on the Lido which again I would thoroughly recommend, it's beautiful and a good respite to Venice main island. The pubic ferries were great (although expensive) but would recommend to making use of these (if you buy a 24/48 hr etc. pass) Overall a great stay but don't expect a luxurious 4* hotel, more like a quirky 3*!

Reviews.Title: “Honey Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Fraise13
Reviews.Content: We started off our honeymoon here. Never before having been to Venice, we still chose to stay outside the central area to have a little more R&R and a little less chaos. Mission, achieved. Quaint hotel, supremely easy to locate, and across the street from the best gelato in all of Venice, Rome and Capri. Very decent breakfast will help you wake up in the morning, though the hardest bed I'd ever slept on in my life helped with that too. Recommend for all, from families to lovers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: OZH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay here. We were pleased that we stayed here rather than in San Marco where we were being charged the same price for a hotel with far less character and amenities. I suggest using the Alilaguna from Marco Polo airport , the blue line is the fastest. It drops you off at the base of the main street in Lido. It takes just under an hour to get here. Walk about 100 yards along the main shopping road and you cant miss this hotel. Its the grandest looking building along the road. The decor on the inside is not as grand as the exterior, but it is pleasant.. The staff are helpful and speak fluent english, you may have to ask for anything you need though. The room we had was large, with A/c, and amenities as described on the website. There was a fridge in the room, but no coffee/tea facility in the room. The bathroom was large with hot/cold water, dryer, and toiletries. We didn't try the onsite resturant, because there are many resturants/cafes all around the hotel. The breakfast room was very nice, and a buffet with adequate variety for everyone including fruit, cereal, meats, eggs, and a choice of coffees. The onsite spa is small, but the massages are very relaxing and professional. There is a terrace at the front of the hotel where you can sit in the evening and relax. Transport to and from the sights of San Marco is easy. The waterbus line 1 takes 15 mins and runs 24 hours, while the less frequent LN takes about 10 mins. The 53 takes about an hour. The area around the hotel is clean, and lined with shops, resturants and other hotels. It feels like a holiday resort (which i guess it is!). We felt very safe walking at all times of the night or day. The beach is a 5 mins walk away, and there is very little traffic on the road at any time of the day. Overall I would stay here again next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, good location for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nash_Bridges_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in Sept 2010. Previously staying in Venice we found hotels there to be poor value and quality. We chose this hotel on Lido as it seemed a reasonable alternative. Ferry from Lido to Venice takes10 minute to nearest point, 20 minute to St Marks Square and 60 minute to furthest point by train station. Hotel is 4-5 minute walk to Lido ferry. The hotel exterior is an interesting looking building. All staff were pleasant apart from one single gruff lady in the spa. Room was slightly cramped for space but had high ceilings to compensate, breakfast was very good, spa relaxing. Local cafes and bars are also pretty good. Overall would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Meg0417
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grande Albergo Ausonia (etc) for a week at the beginning of August and were very pleased with our stay. I can't add very much more to previous reviews but would like to add: The positives: The hotel is situated in the most convenient place! It is about 5 mins walk from the Lido vaparetto stop on the main road. Another 5-10 mins walk away in the other direction takes you to the beach. There is also a supermarket across the road which was very useful. The hotel is also surrounded by restaurants (we ate mostly at the ones across the road which were all very good, though the service was very slow later at night). The breakfast is good, the selection is not huge but there is a bit of everything. The hotel also has a lovely spa and a massage was included in our rate. The negatives: Our room (I think it was 323) smelt quite badly of blocked drains which got progressively worse, luckily we weren't in there for very much so it was bearable, but something to keep in mind when checking in. It would've have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room as it's quite nice to wake up and make one at your own pace instead of rushing downstairs to get a seat at breakfast, again, not really a negative but perhaps the hotel can change this if there is enough demand? The bar area was really nice but we weren't sure why they had 'happy hour' when they didn't seem to have any specials on drinks? All in all, it was a wonderful stay, just a couple of things that could be improved. Staff were friendly and helpful, the spa was good and the hotel is in a fantastic position. Lido is a beautiful island and we really didn't regret our decision to stay outside of Venice. We got a real feel for Venetians and their way of life by staying outside the touristy areas. Also, the food was delicious everywhere we ate and it was reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “If you are visting Venice, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: pkisok
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3rd trip to Lido and 2nd stay at the Grande Albergo Ausonia & Hungaria and we already miss it! This beautiful and unique treasure is staffed by lovely men and women throughout. We stayed for 8 nights and enjoyed the relaxing Lido beach and the easy trip to Venice, with a 15 minute boat ride to San Marco. The hotel also houses the Lanna Gaia spa. During our stay, my husband and I each had 4 treatments, each one better than the next. An absolute pleasure! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best balanced between city and contry in venice”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo-Rome
Reviews.Content: Lido Island, this hotel located in, is 15 minutes boating from SanMarco Square. Compared to such a closer location, this is so quiet and comforatble to stay at. There is a convinient supermarket nearby, and beach is also easy to access. Not only external looks but internal is good including breakfast room. One thing to complain...night sound arond this hotel is a little bit noisy. That's all!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: De_Frank
Reviews.Content: The hotel was built about 100 years ago in the centre of the Lido, one of Europe's most glamourous beach destinations of that time. Today, it hasn't lost anything of its glory. The renovated building facade in Art Nouveau style is really beatiful. Inside, the hotel is also brought up to today's standards. While centrally located on Lido, the hotel is only a few hundred metres away from the dockside where the vaporetti connect up with the rest of Venice. Frequency of the boats is very high, as the Lido site is part of the main lines. There are also direct connections with e.g. the lovely Burrano island or with the Marco Polo airport (via the Alilaguna line). The advantage of staying on the Lido island is that, while you are still within very easy reach of all of Venice's must-see parts of the city, you can actually relax in the evening "away from it all". If you have the time and can stay for a week or more, you can also blend in a day where you simply stay on the Lido island and enjoy the beach or rent a bike. The hotel serves a good breakfast. The breakfast room however can be busy and gets very hot with the sun on the glass walls and ceilings. At the -1 level, an entire floor has been converted to a Thai massage / health center, which is very professionally run. We enjoyed a great massage (a well deserved treat, as Venice can be wearing you down). The hotel bar can be used for pre- or after-dinner drinks. While a set menu is offered for dinner, we didn't find it very attractive. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, so there is no risk of running short of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Nuala23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ausonia & Hungaria in July 2010 it was our first time to Venice and unsure of where to stay on Lido or in main Venice, we are so delighted to have stayed on Lido, the Hotel is fantastic, location, staff, rooms etc we couldn't fault it. Our superior room was a great size for 3 of us, we enjoyed our glass of wine on the terrace in the evening and our breakfasts in the morning. We would highly recommend this hotel and also staying on Lido in July when it's hot, having the beach to swim in and great restaurants and wine bars within a 5 min walk makes it the perfect place to stay when in Venice. 10 mins from Marks Square in the boat, we will definitely be back to Ausonia and Lido. Thanks for a great hol.

Reviews.Title: “By accident, we found this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NinhDzoan
Reviews.Content: Venice was completely booked so a clerk found us this hotel. We were reluctant at first because it was in Lido but it turned out to be only 15-minute boat ride. The hotel was so beautiful and clean. Many tourists stopped to take pictures of the hotel from the street. Food was also less expensive on this island. The buffet was good but not fantastic. The room was small but it was typical in many places in Europe. The staffs Aureliano and Ordalisa were very helpful and wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: RosieOWales
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel for our 25th weddinganniversary. The hotel was beautiful, the staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.Our room although not huge was lovely with a very good ensuite and a fridge.The public rooms were sympathetically restored and very grand.The buffet breakfast,laid out in a huge conservatory/orangery, was varied with a hot and cold selection.There was a spa at the hotel but there is a charge to use it, although you can book spa packages. The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the boat to Venice.The boats runday and night.There are some really good restaurants nearby.We will definitely go back.We stayed for 3 nights and as we had an evening flight home didn't vacate our room until 4 at no extra cost.The beach was a 10 minute stroll, very busy on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venice-Lido experience!”
Reviews.Author: Zadlj
Reviews.Content: We were at Hungaria and Ausutonia Albergo in september this year. It was a week after Mostra del cinema (Venice film festival). We have two small kids, a 5-year old girl and a 7-year old boy. We were enraptured with this hotel. It does not only have absolutely beautiful interior and exterior of Art Nouveau (totally renovated a year ago but very much in touch with its old glamour), but also a very helpful staff, an excellent breakfast, a beautiful Thai SPA center (the center is new, opened in july and it was on a very high level of our expectations) and a beautiful terrace - and these are only few things that I have to mention. The vaporetto station is only few walks away, so you only need 10 minuts to Venice but again you are enjoying a beautiful greenery of an island that Venetians by the way adore. Also the kids liked it very much. And during the evening me and my husband were entangled by the beautiful terrace with discrete music playing, the glass of excellent wine while from the background Beethoven is quietly being heard. I give it a 5 plus stars to this hotel!! (my babygirl is whispering on my ear that she is giving it 10 starsâ€¦ so it is obviously also a very much child likable hotel.) We highly recommend it. We are for sure going again next year again!

Reviews.Title: “A Surprise at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: TinaCambridge
Reviews.Content: How lucky we were to choose this Hotel. It impressed the youngest son who likes a bit of artistic swank along with a traditional design. It impressed the oldest son who likes art and culture and a bit of refinement. A big bonus is the traditional trattoria opposite the Hotel that sees to serve food 24 hours a day 7 days a week! Also fun catching the boat everywhere even on Christmas day.

Reviews.Title: “Service second-to-none!”
Reviews.Author: JORNO
Reviews.Content: We love the Lido anway, and having stayed at a couple of other hotels previously thourght we would try this gorgeous looking hotel, only a couple of minutes from vaporetto stop. ALL the staff without exception were pleasant, friendly and efficient. Nothing was too much trouble, and if you have a late flight home they will attend to your bags whilst you go off and enjoy yourself.! The room was basic, but extremely cleam, twin beds which were very comfotable . the only downside is that the UK adapter we had did not fit their sockets! But no problem, reception lent us one, we only had to ask! The breakfasts had everything you could want, including bacon and eggs, fruit etc and again the waiting staff were quietly efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mirko63
Reviews.Content: I was at Venecia from 7th-17th july with my wife, its our 3rd stay. Grande Albergo Ausonia & Hungaria hotel is beautiful old hotel , its near center of Lido di Venezia, is wery easy to take waterbus to St.Mark's Square. Breakfast is very nice and there is everything you like, its allmost you dont have to eat anything thill next day. Of course, coffe is one of best I ever tryed. Room is very nice with big big bed, ac Staff is very helpful and will tell you everything you need. Hotel have very beautiful teras were every wendsday night is tango dancing and you can enjoy watching or dancing. Hotel is full of antics on every step, and we heard from menager that big amount of money was invested in restoration and look very beatiful, special the ciling. But, the thing that amazed me the much is spa center with thai masage. Hole ambient is just breath takeing, everything is broat from Thailand and of course people from thai work there in masage cener. I excpiriend aromatic masage , which is the D masage to try. Its 110minuts of total relaxation and I recomend to every guest to try. Words cant expalin ! The hole staying in hotels was realy excellent, and if you take the price of staying its best deal. I was realy very satisfied with everything there and for sure i will go there again and i recomend to everybody. If you have any problem how to get there ask the stuff on email or phone and they will tall you how to get there on easyest way. Thay are allways smiled , friendly and very helpful Realy looking to go there again

Reviews.Title: “Tacky-ISSIMO”
Reviews.Author: usignola
Reviews.Content: The exterior of this hotel is truly and exceptionally tacky, even for Italy. The "free wireless internet" does NOT work (confirmed by hotel reception, who did nothing about it during our five-day sojourn), you have to PAY to use the advertized "jacuzzi" since it's in the "spa" (which, however, was closed during our entire stay, so apparently you can't even pay to use it...), and the one manager I met briefly during our time at this hotel was, bizarrely, an ungracious jerk, which may help explain the tacky decor in an area otherwise known for its elegance. I guess what this hotel has going for it is a slightly lower price than it's neighbors, but next time I'll pay the extra five or ten euros a night to not stay in tacky-land. Oh, and one more thing, don't expect to speak English with the staff here (managers included). Fortunately I speak Italian, but I'd advise Anglophone travelers to avoid this hotel since at so many of the other hotels here the staff speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Like living in a rich 'Art Nouveau' palace.”
Reviews.Author: esser
Reviews.Content: This splendid hotel has been recently restored in an overwhelming beautiful and authentic 'Art Nouveau' style. Very friendly staff, especially the young lady supervising the breakfast room. The breakfast is excellent. This hotel is maybe the best place to stay for people who like to come to rest after a day in the heavily vivid town of Venice. An other tip: try to visit Venice in the month of May. There are not so many tourists, the wheather is sunny but not too hot and the hotel rates are still affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - a bit of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: jacqui83Leeds
Reviews.Content: We did not originally book to stay in this hotel however the hotel we did book was being renovated and so Expedia moved us to this one. It is situated on the main road on the Lido and is only a few minutes walk from the water bus stop. I would definitely recomend staying on the Lido, it is a lot quieter than main Venice and the restaurants are cheaper. The hotel was magnificent from the outside and even had a red carpet to walk up from the main street. We stayed in a superior double which was lovely. The room was large in hotel terms and even thought the bed looked like two 3/4s pushed together it was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was big and we had a little closet type room to put our suitcases in. The furniture was minimal but looked antique and added to the room's character. Breakfast was impressive with a large buffet of cereals, toast, eggs, bacon, hams and cheeses as well as pastries and preserves. I was slightly nervous about staying on the Lido as I was worried that it would be too quiet with no bars or shops however I couldn't be more wrong. The main street is lined with restaurants and pizza places and cafes and bars and I noticed two mini supermarkets. Our room looked out onto the main road however the hotel is set far enough back from the road that noise was not an issue. The boats to and from the Lido were very frequent and ran quite late and only took about 10 mins to get to St Mark's Square. The hotel was about a ten minute walk to the public beach and it was nice to be able to walk along the beach or water front on a night and see Venice across the water.

Reviews.Title: “customer service was not on their list of priorities !!”
Reviews.Author: barney43butreally26
Reviews.Content: as we were on our honeymoon! we booked the superior room and what we got was far from superior. we got 2 single beds just pushed together, not ideal when you are on your honeymoon believe me! then the mini-bar which you always had to use the key to get into it, was far from chilled as it did not work at all not that it was that well stocked anyway. no air con was our other problem as i tend to over-heat quite easily and my partner can get a little hot too!!!! apart from all these complaints the room was clean but with absolutly no character left in the rooms whatsoever as the wall were bare white with very silly pictures hanging on them, the furniture was definatly not antique as stated in their website which was dissappointing as we had just come from the most amazing hotel in venice which was full of venetian antique furniture ( al ponte antico- look it up)! when we complained to management the next day he was uncorncerned as he could not have cared less until there was a line of tourists behind us at the desk while we were complaining. lido is beautiful but this hotel is certainly not!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: Joanne35
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here after suddenly having to find a hotel at the last minute but found it a great surprise. The botel is near the Vaparetto stop on the Lido with boats every 10 minutes into the centre of Venice. We had had a particularly busy week up to that point so it was really nice to come back somewhere quieter after the busy days in Venice. On one of the days we went ot the beach for the last part of the afternoon which made a fab. change and then only a 7 minute walk back to the hotel. The rooms were clean in the hotel and the work mentioned in other reviews appeared to be complete (we didn't see any builders during our stay) The staff were very helpful and gave us information whenever we asked, inlcuding restaurant recommendations. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from on the Lido for the evening too. We would recommend staying at this hotel on any trip to Venice

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayoBrighton
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we had mixed feelings about staying at this hotel but we were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel looks great from the outside and is just as good inside. The rooms are very comfortable and plenty of hot water! The staff are very helpful and speak good English. All in all I would recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay out of the main hustle of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “No problems ...”
Reviews.Author: Habs19
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews had me worried about the hotel, relieved to say I worried for nothing. We saw no evidence of the renos that were mentioned earlier and the restaurant was open for brunch which worked out perfectly for us. The location is away from the still large crowds around St. Marks which we really appreciated in the last few days of our vacation after a cruise. Room was on the fourth floor and faced a very quiet lane with Venice off in the distance. The vaporetto was fast ,efficient and a short walk from the hotel. Eateries abound on Lido and are quite reasonable compared to Venice. Hotel is nothing fancy inside but quaint and very clean throughout. We spent little time at the hotel so it was just fine. Staff were friendly and quite willing to help when asked. Wished we could have stayed at the hotel longer and would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully nostalgic; perfect for Venice”
Reviews.Author: jagpacker
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in and it really complements the magic of Venice. In defining nice...charming, cultural, clean, well located, good value. Despite my concerns having read the posting about the renovation work, there really isnâ€™t anything to worry about. The restoration work is absolutely essential to preserve the magnificent majolica tiled exterior and the result of the painstaking work is absolutely outstanding. The faÃ§ade is now a beautiful reflection of its former glory and the interior of the hotel doesnâ€™t disappoint either. The rooms are all really comfortable and summarise the classy atmosphere of days gone by when the Lido was one of the leading destinations for the rich and famous. Everywhere is immaculate and the staff are all exceptionally friendly and helpful; not at all abrupt as I have found in other large hotels. The breakfasts provide everything you need to set you up for a long day exploring the area, offering continental meats, cheeses, pastries alongside fresh fruit, cooked platters, cereals and breads. They are served from 7.30 to 10.30 so early starters and late sleepers are both catered for. There is an American bar open which is a little on the pricey side, but you get to sit on the terrace and soak up the sun and atmosphere. There are also plenty of bars, trattoria and restaurants along the main street that the hotel sits on, so you are never short of choice. The hotel is really well located; just a five minute walk from the Vaporetto stop and in the other direction there is a just a 10 minute walk to the beach. The Vaporetto run regularly over the centre of Venice and also all of the provincial islands and areas. A three day pass costs only â‚¬30 and is definitely worth investing in for the ACTV lines (the only service is doesnâ€™t cover for unlimited travel is the service that links to the airport the Ailaguna service). The Hotel has a private area on the beach left of the Spiaggia public beach, which gets you a sunshade and two beach loungers for less than the public beach. So you can get enjoy the beauty of the main Venice Island with all the hustle and bustle of tourists and the mad chatter of passionate Italians then twin it with a relaxing day on the beach in true Mediterranean style. Having stayed in Venice four times before, this is the place I would go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Building work makes for an unpleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Rivage
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Hungaria Palace(have stayed there twice before and loved it) the hotel is currently a building site. There is no restaurant at the present time- something which we only discovered on checking in. We were not informed of the state of affairs at the hotel when we booked via expedia, and I am now in process of pursuing a complaint regarding this. The terrace is full of workman and the bar service is non-existent. There is a noise and disruption throughout the day making it a very unpleasant place to be. This was not a happy situation as we were there for 10days! The management approach appears to be that the restoration project is paramount whilst the guests just have to put up with the lack of facilities and disruption. We did complain and recieved a letter from the manager agreeing that the hotel was not up to standard and a bottle of prosecco - but it was not enough. Once the renovations are complete the hotel will probably be lovely but I object very strongly to paying a four star price for a noisy and uncomfortable B&B particularly when there was no indication of the situation when we booked. My advice? Do not go there untill you can be sure the work is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Under Renovations and are open?!?!?!”
Reviews.Author: QA1
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe our luck when we arrived at this hotel; it was under renovations, was still operating and did not look safe. This hotel was chosen by my tour company, who should have found us alternative accommodation. I am sure on other occasions it would be a lovely place to stay but the outside of the hotel was covered in scaffolding, there were big pipes running over the ground and excavation around the building. You couldn't enjoy a rest during the day in your room as the works on the site were loud and continuous. Going through the entrance door of the hotel you were confronted with debris falling on you, and the smell of chemicals which caused our family and others on the tour to suffer from severe hay fever. When given our room in this hotel, we were disgusted to find that the floor was spongy and ready to cave in which lead us to complaining to reception to assign us another room. Another couple on our tour also complained about their room and they were given the room we had complained about being unsafe. This hotel should not have been open. Be aware that we were told the renovations were going to continue for several months!!! Note that the buffet breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: amsrm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hungaria Palace for 2 nights during our honeymoon. Located in the island of Lido, it was about a 20 min boat ride from San Marco. Our first impression was great! Lido is a clean little island away from all the crowds and noise. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk away from the boat station. Around it there are several restaurants if you don't feel like going back to the main island after a long day of touring. The hotel itself is very charming starting from the outside. The interior is very well maintained, clean, and surprisingly spacious. Only complaint, albeit small, was that the shower door was too small. We splashed water all over the place, but there's nothing we could have done about it. The staff was very attentive and polite. The breakfast was ok. Although the selection was good and replenished right until the end of the breakfast hour, it wasn't very tasty. However, if it's already included in the price of your room it's still better than buying a breakfast. All in all I would highly staying at this hotel. Although a longer boat ride from St. Lucia station, it's very accessible and away from all the crowds and noise. Besides as a huge bonus we avoided carrying all of our luggage on the hilly streets of the main island.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smn2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It was only a five minute walk from the ferry stop on Lido. We were greeted nicely and escorted directly to our room by one of the staff members. The room was huge with 16 foot ceilings, two separate rooms plus a large bathroom. The bathroom had a large bathtub which I loved. It was the first one I'd seen at any of the hotels we had stayed at in Italy. The hotel also provided a bathrobe and disposable slippers. We decided to stay on Lido because we had read that you get better hotels for your money and this appears to be the case. The hotel was only a fifteen minute boat ride to St. Mark's Square and the boat leaves every 5 or 10 minutes so it was very convenient. The breakfast at the hotel was excellent. There were breads (and the first actual toaster we'd seen at any of the hotels in Italy), scrambled eggs, bacon, cookies, fruit, cereals, etc. The dining area where breakfast was served was also very nice. The hotel price of Euro 150 (including breakfast) was very cheap for the size of the room and service we received. My husband joked that the place must be haunted. It was a large castle-like hotel that was probably much grander in its prime. In summary, this hotel gives you great value for your money in a city that is so expensive. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location”
Reviews.Author: MattSr.
Reviews.Content: In Lido, Venice we stayed at the Hungaria Palace Hotel. Our room was located on the 4th floor (404) and had a great view of the Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta, located below. This street is lined by many cafes and the hotel is only about five minutes walk from the quay where the vaporetti (local ferry) docks ever 15 minutes during the day. The room had a good view, was clean and was comfortable for two. It had both air condition and a TV which allowed us to watch CNN to catch up on the dayâ€™s news when we returned to our room late at nights. The streets were well lit and we felt very safe in Lido and Venice as a whole. The hotel staff were helpful, friendly, courteous and made our stay in Venice a pleasurable one. It is evident that this hotel prides itself on customer service and through its highly motivated staff tries to ensure the comfort and well being of all of its guests. The breakfast was substantial as their served eggs, bacon, fruits, juices, coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: Surferdudes
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice in August with my 10 year old daughter. I chose the Lido as I thought the combination of the beach and a short boat ride into Venice would be better for her. I'm so glad I did, this was an ideal place to stay. We spent a couple of days sightseeing in Venice and a couple of days on the Lido, hiring bikes and on the beach. We found the Hungaria Palace an ideal place to stay, located 5 minutes from the beach on one side and 5 minutes to the boat terminal on the other. The hotel was lovely and clean, our room was nice, the staff were friendly, breakfast was good. We really enjoyed it and overall I feel we made an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place - perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: flashgordon2
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place to stay - the ferry runs every 10 min over to Venice main town and also to other islands. If you purchase the blue or orange ferry cards for 1 to 7 days this is really great value . The hotel is in a great location - bang on the main street and 5min walk to the ferry or the other way to the beach . The hotel itself is a good standard - a bit expensive to eat in the restaurant - but who needs this when there are plenty of places around. We found this a really good place to return to after long hot days sightseeing - I would recomend it . I travelled with an older relative ( although very fit ) and we both found this to be a good experience . There is also a boat directly from Marco Polo Airport to the Lido island and it takes about 40 min . Try not to have loads of luggage as there is a bit of a walk to the boat , however it all adds to the great experience of Venice .

HotelInfo.Name: Grande Albergo Ausonia & Hungaria Wellness & Spa on Venice Lido Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta, 28, 30126 Venice, Italy
